;马来西亚音乐节的组织者寻求 1230 万林吉特（270 万美元）该公司律师周五表示，英国乐队 The 1975 因主唱在舞台上抗议该国反同性恋法律而导致当局关闭该音乐节，造成了损失。

;

;Future Sound Asia 致函给FSA 律师 David Dinesh Mathew 表示，乐队周一因违反合同而要求赔偿。

;

;在 7 月 21 日的演出中，马蒂·希利 (Matty Healy) 在演讲中使用脏话批评马来西亚政府反对同性恋的立场，然后亲吻了贝斯手罗斯·麦克唐纳 (Ross MacDonald) 在吉隆坡 Good Vibes 音乐节的开幕表演中。表演的视频发布在社交媒体上，在这个穆斯林占主导地位的国家引发了强烈反对。

;

;在马来西亚，同性恋是一种犯罪行为，最高可判处 20 年监禁，并可处以鞭刑。

;< h3>;歌手 Matty Healy 猛烈抨击马来西亚的反 LGBTQ 法律，在台上亲吻男贝斯手;

;政府猛烈抨击 Healy 的行为，将乐队列入马来西亚黑名单，并缩短了为期三天的音乐节。 LGBTQ 群体中的一些人也在社交媒体上批评乐队，称希利扰乱了推动变革的活动人士的工作，也危及了社区。;

;马修在信中表示，乐队已经给予了展会前的书面承诺表明其将遵守所有当地准则和法规。相反，希利的“使用辱骂性语言、损坏设备和不雅的舞台行为”给 FSA 造成了经济损失。

;

;马修周五在一份书面声明中表示，“不幸的是，这一保证被忽视了”。 “他们的行为对当地艺术家和小企业产生了影响，他们依靠节日来获得创作机会和生计。”

;

;因此，他表示 FSA 要求 The 1975 承认他们的责任并支付费用赔偿所造成的损失。

;

;FSA 在其网站上表示正在满足所有退款请求。

;

;律师表示 FSA 将在英格兰法院采取法律行动如果乐队未能在周一（即发出法律索赔信一周后）之前做出回应。

;

;在马来西亚首都遭遇惨败后，乐队取消了在台湾和印度尼西亚雅加达的演出。这并不是希利第一次以 LGBTQ 权利的名义在舞台上做出如此挑衅性的表演：2019 年，他在阿拉伯联合酋长国的一场音乐会上亲吻了一名男歌迷，而阿拉伯联合酋长国禁止同性性行为。

;香港反贪会正在调查香港中文大学 (CUHK) 经营的医学研究中心）针对不当行为和滥用资金的指控，官员搜查了该处所以寻找证据。

;

;廉政公署（ICAC）周五表示，正在调查腐败、公职不当行为和挪用公款的指控。

;

;“廉署人员今日在中大进行调查及取证，包括根据法庭发出的手令进行约谈及搜查场所。

;

;”该委员会表示，现阶段尚未逮捕任何人。

;

;香港立法会可能援引特别权力调查大学理事会

;

;反腐败机构表示不会进一步置评由于案件仍在调查中。

;

;中大发言人表示，校方暂时不会发表评论。

;

;调查进行之际，中大校董会成员对拟议的改革提出异议

;

;有立法会议员还呼吁对中大校长段崇智的领导能力进行特别调查。

;

;中大校长不见踪影，却成为立法会改革风暴的中心

;

;在立法会主席柴逸超教授在立法会会议上发言后，仔细审查改革建议的立法会议员也表示担忧据称，他在制定议程时被绕开，并且不知道段的薪水或奖金。

;

;这位大学校长也因未能参加三场讨论中大治理变革的会议而受到立法者的猛烈抨击理事会。

;中国正试图表达对菲律宾的不满以及加强与美国的联盟据观察人士称，中国对南海有争议的浅滩采取了更强硬的立场。

;

;在中国海岸警卫队使用高压水枪破坏向菲律宾军队运送物资的任务后，敌对声索国之间的紧张关系正在加剧驻扎在一艘故意在仁爱礁搁浅的二战军舰上，以宣示马尼拉的主权主张。

;

;中国也声称对南沙群岛的珊瑚礁拥有主权，自上周末的对峙以来，中国海岸警卫队已发表多项声明指责菲律宾“一再无视中方警告，试图运送建筑材料用于修复和加固”该船。

;

;与此同时，菲律宾谴责菲律宾所谓的“危险举动”中方和小费迪南德·马科斯总统否认了中国关于菲律宾已承诺移除 BRP Sierra Madre 号船只的说法。

;

;菲律宾之前的补给任务也曾导致过对抗，包括 2 月份发生的一起事件：马尼拉指责中国海岸警卫队将军用级激光指向其一艘船只。

;

;当时北京否认了这一指控，中国外交部呼吁双方就海上争端进行沟通。< /p>;

;随着中国紧张局势升级，菲律宾将向礁石派遣更多物资和船只

;

;东南亚-尤索夫伊萨研究所智库高级研究员伊恩·斯托里 (Ian Storey) 表示，北京在最新事件可能反映出中国对马科斯领导下的马尼拉和华盛顿加强关系的愤怒。

;

;“中国加大了在南海的赌注，以表达对马科斯政府在南海问题上采取更强硬立场的不满。” ”

;

;当马尼拉四月份允许华盛顿进入另外四个军事基地时，北京感到不安。这些基地包括一个靠近中国位于南沙群岛美济礁和永暑礁的人工岛的基地，以及两个距离台湾约 500 公里（310 英里）的基地，台湾现在是一个主要的潜在爆发点。

;

;在另一项努力中为了重振与美国的联盟，菲律宾表示将恢复2016年被前总统罗德里戈·杜特尔特暂停的与美国在南海的联合巡逻。

;

;副研究员丁铎中国南部海南省南海研究院的研究员表示：“美菲同盟的加强确实可能会产生一定的影响，特别是当菲律宾越来越愿意与美国战略结盟时，美国实际上已经

;

;“但出发点更多还是出于中国维护领土主权的需要，中国试图在领土争端问题上划定底线。”

;<据信，这是为了对抗美国的影响力，中国还提出与菲律宾举行联合军演，但菲律宾国家安全委员会助理总干事乔纳森·马拉亚表示，这种做法没有法律依据。此类演习。

;

;周日事件曝光后不久，北京表示，美国试图“鼓励和支持菲律宾修复和加固”BRP Sierra Madre。

;

;菲律宾谴责中国在其船只上“危险”使用水炮

;

;中国外交部表示，美国还试图通过强调其与菲律宾的共同防御条约来威胁中国，该条约将迫使华盛顿来到马尼拉援助号是其在国际公认的菲律宾水域遭受攻击的船只之一。

;

;虽然预计北京和马尼拉可能会试图阻止对抗进一步升级，但观察人士表示，最近的对抗将蒙上阴影周三，菲律宾军方表示，已准备好“在未来几年内执行另一次补给任务”。两周”。

;

;“（行为准则谈判）气氛并不理想，菲律宾可能会采取更强硬的立场或在谈判中提高讨价还价，”丁说。

;<斯托里表示，最近发生的事件“只是凸显了南海问题[行为准则]的必要性”。然而，由于对协议的地理范围以及是否应具有法律约束力存在分歧，最终文件（有助于解决争端）可能仍需要数年时间。

;

;“不幸的是，最终协议不太可能达成今年甚至明年就达到了，”斯托里补充道。

;中国第二大短视频应用运营商快手科技正在加倍努力在中国经济复苏不平衡的情况下，该公司正在与其他科技巨头争夺一个难得的增长市场的份额。

;

;这家总部位于北京的公司表示，它将向本地服务提供数千万人民币的补贴帮助有影响力的人提高平台上团购交易的销售额。

;

;该计划于周四在上海举行的一次企业活动上宣布，是快手飞鸟项目的一部分，该项目旨在提高当地产品的销售额

;

;其他支持包括佣金激励、在线流量导流、培训课程以及升级的在线工具以帮助管理销售。

;< p>;“我们希望通过一系列的投资，让网红更容易运营，并激励更多的短视频创作者加入成为网红。”快手本地服务业务高管石春晓表示。

;< p>;在中国，本地服务指的是利用在线平台向互联网用户提供线下消费服务，例如餐厅和酒店预订。

;

;快手在该领域的投资不断增加，这使得该公司对一些该行业最大的参与者，包括点播服务巨头美团、阿里巴巴集团支持的饿了么以及字节跳动旗下的短视频应用抖音。

;

;抖音的本地服务业务于 2018 年推出据中国媒体《LatePost》最近报道，今年上半年，其平台上销售的商品价值超过 1000 亿元人民币（139 亿美元），几乎是美团同期销售额的一半。< /p>;

;《南华早报》母公司阿里巴巴的本地服务收入同比飙升 30% 至 19 亿美元，部分原因是其外卖服务饿了么订单量强劲增长根据该公司最新的财报。

;

;史在 2023 年前 6 个月的公司活动中表示，快手本地服务的交易用户数和商品总价值在 2023 年前六个月飙升了 498% 和 848%。星期四，没有详细说明具体数字。

;

;随着腾讯的微信视频频道和上海的生活方式社交媒体应用程序小红书最近也进军该领域，本已竞争激烈的本地服务市场将变得更加拥挤。 .

;

;分析师表示，由于中国科技公司的一些主要业务已经陷入停滞状态，本地服务为中国科技公司提供了新的增长来源。

;

;市场咨询公司Dolphin创始人兼首席分析师李成东表示，快手和抖音的商业业务都已触及天花板，促使它们进军本地服务的增长市场，特别是在中国取消Covid-19限制之后。

;

;艾媒咨询发布的报告显示，2025年中国按需本地服务市场规模预计将达到2.5万亿元。报告称，随着越来越多的公司进入市场，未来本地服务行业将成为多平台竞争。

;

;快手和抖音等短视频应用可能会挑战美团在该领域的主导地位，因为它们李说，“美团的优势在于一四线城市，而不是小县城，因为那里的外卖需求几乎不存在。” “但即使在那些县，快手和抖音也很受欢迎。”

;好莱坞大片《芭比娃娃》于周五在日本上映，其中“Barbenheimer”模因将以原子弹为主题的娃娃电影引起了轰动，发行商华纳兄弟在上映前道歉。

;

;由玛格特·罗比主演的《芭比娃娃》门票在日本卖得很快，粉丝们蜂拥而至。上映时间恰逢国定假日，标志着日本延长暑假周的第一天。

;

;“芭比娃娃的粉色世界绝对美丽”，29 岁的铃木美咲 (Misaki Suzuki) 说道美甲沙龙工作人员在东京一家电影院看完这部电影后。

;

;自 7 月 21 日首映以来，《芭比娃娃》的全球票房已突破 10 亿美元，使编剧兼导演格蕾塔·葛韦格成为第一位超越这一基准的女性电影制片人作为独奏导演。与奥本海默的合作进一步推动了这部奇幻喜剧的成功，这部传记片记录了第二次世界大战期间原子弹的制造过程，该片于同一周末上映。

;

;但“巴本海默”的组合引发了轰动。日本本月早些时候举行了纪念 78 年前美国广岛和长崎原子弹爆炸的活动，这在日本引起了强烈反对。

;

;美国特使的芭比娃娃帖子在日本火上浇油，人们对表情包的愤怒日益高涨< /h3>;

;在 X 平台（以前称为 Twitter）上现已删除的帖子中，华纳兄弟的芭比娃娃营销帐户锁定了粉丝制作的表情包，其中描绘了罗比与奥本海默演员希里安·墨菲以及核爆炸的图像。;

;8 月 1 日，Change.org 发起请愿书，要求华纳兄弟和奥本海默背后的工作室环球影业停止在社交媒体上使用 #Barbenheimer 标签。迄今为止，它已经收集了大约 22,600 个签名。

;

;当时，#NoBarbenheimer 标签在日本流行，促使华纳的日本部门罕见地公开批评其美国母公司，并随后道歉周。

;

;在日语版本中为芭比娃娃配音的高畑光希 (Mitsuki Takahata) 在 8 月 2 日的 Instagram 帖子中表示，她在得知这些表情包后感到沮丧。她发帖称：“这起事件真的非常令人失望。”

;

;尽管如此，这部将美泰标志性玩偶带入现实生活的电影的日本粉丝表示，争议并没有阻止他们去电影院。

;

; p>;

;“这很残酷”，24 岁的大学生 Rie Takeda 在评论粉丝制作的#Barbenheimer memes 时说道。

;

;“但这部电影光芒四射，超出了我的想象。她说：“观看这部电影很有趣”。

;

;《奥本海默》尚未公布在日本的上映日期，该片因在很大程度上忽视了 1945 年原子弹摧毁日本两个主要城市、导致超过 20 万人死亡而受到批评。 .

;印度的 Subway 三明治将不再提供免费奶酪片的选项分析人士认为，菜单的修改更多的是为了削减成本，而不仅仅是口味问题。

;

;美国连锁店赛百味是印度最大的餐厅特许经营商之一，拥有约 800 家门店。现在，他们对大多数三明治中的奶酪片额外收取 30 卢比（0.40 美元）费用，但改为提供免费的“奶酪”酱。

;

;包括乳制品在内的原料价格上涨，导致全球快餐业陷入困境。印度的连锁店面临着削减成本同时保持顾客满意的压力。

;

;达美乐最便宜的披萨在印度的促销价仅为 60 美分，其特许经营商已公开表达了对印度披萨价格上涨 40% 的担忧。 3 月份结束的财政年度中奶酪的价格上涨。

;

;最近几周，印度的许多赛百味和麦当劳门店也从菜单中删除了西红柿，理由是西红柿价格飙升 450% 左右，创历史新高后存在质量问题。 .

;

;印度不得不从尼泊尔进口西红柿来缓解短缺问题。

;

;印度菜世界排名第五，让印度人的口味不好

;

; Everstone Group 的 Culinary Brands 表示，现在 Subway India 免费提供的奶酪酱“仅出于质量原因而开发”。Everstone Group 的 Culinary Brands 管理着所有 800 家门店的供应链，并且是大约 200 家门店的主要特许经营商。

;

;质变显然并不符合所有人的口味。

;

;赛百味“用液体奶酪混合物取代了奶酪片……你只是失去了一位忠实的顾客”，一位不为所动的顾客苏米特·阿罗拉 (Sumit Arora) 在社交媒体 X 上写道。媒体平台，以前称为 Twitter。

;

;新德里的一家 Subway 商店经理表示，新的奶酪酱每公斤售价 400 卢比（5 美元）。市场价格显示，奶酪片的价格通常约为每公斤 700 卢比（8.50 美元）。

;

;从印度尼西亚掠夺的雕像、宝石和珠宝在前殖民统治者手中保存了一个多世纪荷兰已抵达雅加达，并正在该市的国家博物馆进行编目，专家们对这个东南亚国家如何处理大量文物表示担忧，因为该国博物馆基础设施有限且有盗窃历史。

;“有不同等级的文物荷兰皇家东南亚和加勒比研究所 (KITLV) 和 NIOD 战争、大屠杀和种族灭绝研究所的印度尼西亚研究员阿德里安·佩尔卡萨 (Adrian Perkasa) 表示： /p>;

;为什么印度尼西亚人说荷兰承认 1945 年独立是“巨大的侮辱”

;

;从 1800 年起，印度尼西亚在近 150 年的时间里一直是荷兰直辖殖民地，并被称为荷兰东部独立国家。它因其丰富的自然资源而被殖民统治者剥削，并成为全球香料贸易的枢纽。

;

;

;

;

;印度尼西亚的“科科西奇的文化大使旨在保护中国遗产

;

;

;最后一次已知的博物馆抢劫案发生在 2022 年，发生在南苏拉威西岛拉帕瓦沃伊博物馆，博物馆 95% 的藏品都丢失了。

;

; p>;

;“作为一名艺术爱好者，我去过国内外的博物馆，”PSI 党立法候选人玛莎·西亚吉安 (Marsha Siagian) 说道，她补充说，她的政党对遣返文物的未来深感担忧.

;

;“恐怕我不得不说我们的安全标准还没有达到。我不愿意看到它们中的任何一个最终成为只有少数人喜欢的私人收藏的一部分。”

;

;居住在阿姆斯特丹的印度尼西亚历史学家乔斯·维比索诺 (Joss Wibisono) 表示，荷兰媒体的一些部分也提出了质疑”关于将不可替代的文物归还印度尼西亚的明智之举。

;

;“总体情绪良好，但一些人不相信印度尼西亚能够妥善保管它们，”他说，并补充说荷兰媒体报道Klungkung 的世袭国王声称他对祖先的短剑（一把精心制作的礼仪匕首）即将回归一无所知。

;“这暗示着雅加达的精英未能与起源的核心政党进行协调Wibisono 补充道。

;印度尼西亚政府发誓，在这些来之不易的国家传家宝归还后，将尽最大努力保护和保存它们，以便子孙后代能够从中受益。

; Fri, 11 Aug 2023 18:20:01 +0800 ‘Emotional garbage bins’: Chinese parents who use ‘guilt-inflicting’ mental tricks to induce hard study urged to stophttps://www.scmp.com/news/people-culture/trending-china/article/3230521/emotional-garbage-bins-chinese-parents-who-use-guilt-inflicting-mental-tricks-induce-hard-study?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.11 18:00;
;;

;中国父母“鼓励”孩子努力学习或成为一个新趋势专家表示，通过让孩子感到内疚来服从可能会导致青少年出现长期的心理问题。

;

;所谓的“内疚教育”及其可能造成的损害，让大陆社交媒体上的一些观察人士认为，呼吁家长不要把孩子当作“情感垃圾箱”。

;

;7月，一位来自中国东部浙江省的母亲在网上发布了一段视频，视频中，家里的父亲光着膀子坐着，手里拿着香烟据自媒体平台报道，母亲说，父亲告诉孩子：“爸爸两天只睡了四个小时，每天只吃一次。当我开车去工厂的时候，我连休息的空调都不用。”

;

;父亲接着一一列举了他日常生活中遇到的问题和困难以及挣扎的过程。他必须供养她，试图让女儿感到内疚，从而更加努力地学习。

;

;视频中，明显心疼的女孩坐在桌旁听父亲讲话。

;<她的母亲谈到视频时说：“他不善于表达自己，很少和孩子说话。他不介意受苦，但他不想让孩子和他一样受苦。”

;

;虽然这位父亲的初衷可能值得称赞，但他的行为却引发了网上的愤怒。

;

; p>;

;一位网友说：“内疚教育是自卑感从童年开始的。”

;

;另一位网友补充道：“你的痛苦不是你女儿造成的，她的痛苦源于你。 .”

;

;“控制你自己。把烟从嘴里拿出来。穿上衬衫，以尊重和平等的态度与您的孩子沟通。 Do not use your child as an emotional garbage bin,” a third person said.

;

;Traditional Chinese culture emphasises the virtue of xiaoshun, or filial piety.

;

;Instead of seeing their children as independent individuals and viewing selfless devotion to them as natural, a return is expected in the shape of obedience and hard work.

;

;This outlook can often involve making the child feel guilty by using emotional manipulation.

;

;This cultural viewpoint even extends to the media.

;

;For example, in the Chinese TV show Don't Underestimate Me, a four-year-old daughter who is struggling with her homework is upbraided by her mother who insists she must memorise it before she can sleep.

;

;Eventually, at 1am, the hysterical mother resorts to slapping herself as a warning to her daughter that she will continue to do so each time the girl fails to meet her expectations.

;

;While the TV case might be extreme, other forms of inflicting guilt are more subtle and can include emotional blackmail, such as blaming the child for relationship problems between his or her parents.

;

;Dr Paul Wong Wai-ching, a clinical psychologist and associate professor in the Department of Social Work and Social Administration at the University of Hong Kong, said it is difficult to define such behaviour as child abuse or family violence.

;

;“The definition of verbal abuse is hard to define, and it differs across different cultures,” he said.

;

;Wong said Western culture tends to use praise as a motivator.

;

;“The traditional Confucian way of teaching is not to praise your child, unlike in the Western educational style. Sometimes we provoke guilt in the child in the hope that they will work harder, and that they will be academically better.”

;

;“This means that they can have better social mobility, status and power. This has long been the case, especially in countries with a Confucian tradition like Korea, Japan and China,” Wong added.

;

;The Western method of praising children to motivate them has been tried by Chinese parents, but failed to catch on, Wong said.

;

;This has led to a resurgence in guilt-provoking education, which has consequences, according to Wong.

;

;One potential long-term result, according to the academic, is that when children exposed to the guilt-inflicting method growing up they cannot get along with their elderly parents.

;

;“It is also likely to make people anxious, extremely anxious, make them worry about making mistakes and make them want to become a perfect child. They won't want to take risks, will not know how to take risks and will always be humble, always keeping their heads down,” Wong added.

; Fri, 11 Aug 2023 18:20:01 +0800 US wants China’s chip industry 5 generations behind cutting edge, head of equipment maker AMEC says at Wuxi conferencehttps://www.scmp.com/tech/big-tech/article/3230803/us-wants-chinas-chip-industry-5-generations-behind-cutting-edge-head-equipment-maker-amec-says-wuxi?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.11 18:00;
;;

;The head of one of China's leading semiconductor equipment makers believes Washington's escalating export and investment restrictions betray the real goal of the US: keep China's chip-making technology at least five generations behind the cutting edge.

;

;Advanced Micro-Fabrication Equipment Inc China (AMEC) chairman and CEO Gerald Yin Zhiyao made the comments on Thursday at the China Semiconductor Equipment Annual Conference in Wuxi, a city near Shanghai in eastern China. He referred to the US export restrictions imposed last October, which came ahead of another escalation this week when the Biden administration unveiled plans to restrict investment into China in sensitive areas including semiconductors.

;

;“The October rules really exposed the US' true intention, which aims to fix China's chip-making on 28-nanometre, at least five generations behind the global leading edge of 3-nm to 14-nm,” Yin said during his talk at the conference. “We can't accept [this],” he added.

;

;Yin described the updated US tech export controls targeting all China-based foundries as the most “lethal” ban since the US started rolling out related sanctions on China's hi-tech firms in 2019. Yin called the latest executive order – which targets US investment into China's semiconductor, artificial intelligence and quantum computing industries – as Washington's “16th move” against the country since then.

;

;The rules imposed last October aim to cap China's logic chip-making capabilities at the 14-nm level, DRAM chips at 18-nm and 3D NAND memory at 128 layers. The US cited national security risks and the potential military applications of advanced chips.

;

;Yin, a 20-year veteran of the US chip equipment industry including time at Applied Materials, said locally-procured semiconductor equipment in China's foundries accounted for just 15 per cent of the total. The other 85 per cent of machines come from the US, Netherlands and Japan, he said.

;

;“That's why the US needed Japan and Netherlands on board to curb our development,” he told a room packed with semiconductor professionals and investors.

;

;Chinese semiconductor equipment firms still lag global peers in both market share and technological sophistication, according to industry professionals attending the conference. China's tool makers have virtually no global presence in some segments such as lithography. Catching up in these areas is an uphill battle for Chinese firms in a worsening geopolitical environment that is squeezing out foreign money and technological cooperation.

;

;Li Jinxiang, deputy secretary general of China Electronic Production Equipment Industry, said some China-made equipment fails to meet the efficiency needs of foundries.

;

;“It's a huge waste that a 1 billion yuan [US$138.7 million] ASML-made lithography machine has to wait for a domestically-made wafer coating and developing machine to catch up in speed,” Li said, referring to the Dutch chip equipment firm that has a virtual monopoly on the most advanced lithography machines.

;

;An ASML lithography machine is capable of processing 350 12-inch wafers per hour, Li explained, while China-made wafer coating and developing machines cannot match that output.

;

;A wafer coating and developing machine is crucial in assisting the lithography process. It applies the light-sensitive photoresist material to the wafer, which is then put into lithography systems for exposure. The machine then takes the exposed wafer to develop the pattern.

;

;However, Yin said he has confidence that China can develop a globally competitive equipment industry within years, as many US-trained Chinese experts have returned home. Using chip-making equipment to curb China's progress will yield no good results, he said.

;

;Yin also called AMEC's brief inclusion in 2021 on a US defence department list of companies allegedly supporting the Chinese military “sheer nonsense”. It was the first time Yin publicly commented on the US sanctions against AMEC.

;

;He said the US “reluctantly” removed AMEC from the list after “four months of intense negations”.

; Fri, 11 Aug 2023 18:20:01 +0800 Chinese military scientists claim to have achieved a ‘huge breakthrough’ on laser weapon technologyhttps://www.scmp.com/news/china/science/article/3230589/chinese-military-scientists-claim-have-achieved-huge-breakthrough-laser-weapon-technology?utm_source=rss_feed
;;2023.08.11 17:00;
;;

;Chinese military scientists have announced a major breakthrough in laser weapon technology, claiming they have developed a new cooling system that allows high-energy lasers to operate “infinitely” without any build-up of waste heat.

;

;According to scientists at the National University of Defence Technology, in Changsha, Hunan province, the new cooling system completely eliminates the harmful heat that is generated during the operation of high-energy lasers. The issue has been a major technical challenge for laser weapon development.

;

;With the new technology, weapons can now generate laser beams for as long as they want, without any interruption or degradation in performance.

;

;“This is a huge breakthrough in improving the performance of high-energy laser systems,” said the team led by laser weapon scientist Yuan Shengfu in a paper published on August 4 in Acta Optica Sinica, a Chinese-language peer-reviewed journal.

;

;“High-quality beams can be produced not only in the first second, but also maintained indefinitely,” they said.

;

;The new cooling system uses advanced structures and optimised gas flow to remove heat from inside the laser weapon, while minimising turbulence and vibration and improving mirror cleanliness.

;

;It has the potential to significantly change the face of battle by extending engagement times, increasing range and damage, and reducing logistics and costs, according to the researchers.

;

;“Since the invention of the first ruby laser in 1960, people have been enthusiastic about transitioning from kinetic energy to laser energy for the rapid projection of energy at the speed of light, dreaming of laser beams to become 'death rays' that can instantly kill targets,” Yuan and his colleagues said.

;

;“Unfortunately, 60 years have passed and while various types of lasers have been developed, the application of high-energy laser systems has not been successful.”

;

;In the United States, some of the most famous projects throughout the years include the Navy Advanced Chemical Laser (NACL) that used deuterium fluoride as a laser source, the Middle Infrared Advanced Chemical Laser (MIRACL) that used advanced mid-infrared chemical lasers, the Tactical High Energy Laser (THEL), the Space-Based Laser (SBL) that used hydrogen fluoride as a laser source, and the Airborne Laser (ABL) that used chemical oxygen iodine lasers.

;

;These have all been demonstrated in test fields, with MIRACL having shot down supersonic missiles, THEL having shot down 48 flying targets and ABL having successfully intercepted liquid fuel missiles, according to Yuan's team.

;

;But the projects were all cancelled, with the reason given to the public being the large size and weight of the lasers.

;

;“The true reason for the cancellation of these projects was that their destructive power did not meet expectations,” the scientists said.

;

;The maximum effective range of these weapons was only a few kilometres. Yuan's team said to improve the destructive power of a beam, “longer continuous operation times are needed”.

;

;Inside the laser weapon, a high-energy beam is generated through a process called stimulated emission. This involves exciting atoms or molecules in a gain medium, such as a crystal or gas, to a higher energy state.

;

;When these excited atoms or molecules return to their ground state, they emit photons, which are then amplified through a process of optical feedback to create a high-energy laser beam.

;

;The beam control system is responsible for directing and controlling the laser beam, typically through the use of mirrors and lenses. This system must be highly precise and stable, as even small deviations or vibrations can cause the beam to miss its designated course.

;

;But as the laser beam passes through the air, it heats up the gas in its path, causing it to expand and create a turbulent flow.

;

;This turbulence can cause the beam to scatter and distort, reducing its effectiveness and accuracy.

;

;Additionally, the heated gas can cause the mirrors and lenses in the system to become contaminated, leading to a decline in performance and a shortened lifespan.

;

;In some cases, larger pollutant particles burning on the mirrors can even result in them being cracked or damaged, greatly reducing the practicability and reliability of the high-energy laser weapons, according to the researchers.

;

;Yuan's team has developed an internal beam path conditioner – a system that blows gas through the weapon to remove waste heat and improve gas cleanliness.

;

;It is designed to be compact and efficient, with a focus on optimising gas flow and minimising size and weight.

;

;It has several key components, including an air source, a heat exchanger, a gas flow control system and a gas injection/suction system.

;

;The air source provides a supply of clean, dry air to the system, which is then passed through the heat exchanger to cool it down to the desired temperature.

;

;The gas flow control system regulates the flow of gas, ensuring it is delivered at the correct temperature and dwell time to achieve quasi-static small aberrations.

;

;The gas injection/suction system is responsible for injecting the gas into the internal beam path of the laser system and removing it after it has passed through.

;

;Yuan's team had to pay careful attention to a number of technical and practical points when building and operating the internal beam path conditioner.

;

;One of the main challenges was ensuring the gas flow achieved the desired cooling and cleaning effects. This required careful design and testing of the gas flow control system, as well as the injection/suction system that delivers the gas to the internal beam path.

;

;Another challenge was making it compact and efficient enough to be practical for use in real-world applications.
